notes: ICE, CBP, Border Patrol, and IRS Criminal Investigation executed federal search warrant on May 20, 2025. 17 arrested (9 men, 7 women) - one of first workplace raids involving IRS participation. VERIFIED: April 24, 2025, ~20 armed federal agents raided wrong NW Oklahoma City home. 'Marisa' and 3 daughters (US citizens, moved from Maryland 2 weeks prior) forced outside in underwear before dressing. Marisa: 'My husband has not even seen my daughter in her undergarments - her own dad.' Kept saying 'We're citizens!' Phones, laptops, life savings seized. Search warrant named previous residents. DHS admitted error - previous tenants were targets. 8 Guatemalan nationals indicted for human smuggling. US Marshals denied involvement; FBI referred to DHS. Items could take 'days or months' to return.

victim_name: Child struck during father's confrontation with ICE
notes: MANUALLY VERIFIED: June 8, 2025 Highlandtown, Baltimore. ICE officers confronted a Baltimore City resident near a grocery store. His wife, three children, and 80-year-old mother were present. outcome: peaceful rally completed, no arrests or force used
notes: ~400 protesters marched from Casa de Maryland Welcome Center on Pulaski Highway to Royal Farms and Hazlo International Foods grocery store. CASA organized 2-hour march in response to 16+ ICE detentions in prior 3 weeks, including 3 raids at Hazlo between June 6-8. CASA reported ICE officer struck child during June 8 confrontation. Councilwoman Odette Ramos (first Latina elected to City Council) participated. 184% increase in MD ICE arrests vs 2024 (3,300 vs 1,165).

VERIFIED: Jan 23, 2025 at ~11 AM: ~12 ICE agents raided Ocean Seafood Depot (family-owned since 1998) at Adams St in Ironbound section, Newark. Detained 3 workers including warehouse manager - Puerto Rican US citizen and military veteran. Owner Luis Janota: detained 'because he was Hispanic.' Mayor Baraka: agent 'suffered the indignity of having the legitimacy of his military documentation questioned.' ICE confirmed Jan 23 date. No warrant produced. Sens. Booker & Kim condemned treatment. Second raid at same location Nov 2025.

notes: Operation Patriot - ICE's largest operation at that time. 1,461 arrested throughout May 2025 in Greater Boston and Massachusetts. 790 had criminal convictions or charges, 277 had final removal orders. Targeted MS-13, Tren de Aragua, Trinitarios, 18th Street gangs. ICE worked with FBI, CBP, ATF, US Marshals, Coast Guard. Included simultaneous operations on Nantucket and Martha's Vineyard (~40 arrests). Described as most difficult operation due to sanctuary jurisdictions providing no local assistance.
Operation Patriot 2.0 - 1,406 arrested Sep 4-30. 600+ had 'significant criminal convictions'. Conditions at Burlington facility described as 'abysmal' - people sleeping on concrete.

May 8, 2025 at 11:13 AM on Eureka Street: ICE detained unnamed Brazilian mother. Hostile crowd of ~25 surrounded agents. TWO ARRESTED: (1) Ashley Spring, 38, school board candidate, pushed officers and threw liquid (later confirmed water). Charged: assault/battery on officer, assault with dangerous weapon, disorderly conduct, interfering. (2) Juvenile female held infant in front of vehicle, kicked car door. Charged: reckless endangerment of child, disturbing peace, disorderly conduct, resisting arrest. Spring released on personal recognizance, placed on UNPAID leave. Later ruled ineligible for ballot (voted Bolton Nov 2024).

ACLU/UFW lawsuit filed against CBP for unlawful practices.

notes: Civilian sniper attack on ICE facility near Love Field. Joshua Jahn (29, Fairview) shot 3 detainees from rooftop of immigration lawyer's building. Norlan Guzman-Fuentes (37, El Salvador) killed at scene. Miguel Ángel García-Hernández died Sept 30 after being shot 8 times - was in final stages of fixing immigration status. Third victim Jose Andres Bordones-Molina survived. FBI found handwritten notes showing Jahn planned attack for months, intended to terrorize ICE agents.
outcome_detail: 2 detainees killed, 1 injured in sniper attack

notes: Joint operation with FBI, DEA, ATF. Coast Guard provided boats. Workers disappeared from farms, lumberyards, ferryboats. Governor Healey got 'zero information' about arrests.
Mt. Baker Roofing Company. 56 falsified green cards found in 84 I-9 forms. Agents arrived with guns drawn at 7:30am. All 37 taken to Tacoma NWDC. Community raised funds for affected families.

Federal officers fired pepper balls and deployed tear gas outside Whipple Federal Building. Judge Katherine Menendez issued injunction barring federal agents from using less-lethal munitions on peaceful protesters. By Jan 11, city reported 30 arrests. Part of Operation Metro Surge - largest ICE operation ever with 2,000+ agents deployed to Twin Cities since Jan 6.
outcome_detail: 30 arrested at weekend protests, 1 officer minor injury
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Metro Surge with 2000+ federal agents.

outcome: 3 children and parents hospitalized, infant required CPR
notes: Destiny Jackson (26) and family of 8 returning from son's basketball game pulled over due to protest/parked cars blocking road. ICE agent yelled at them to 'get the F out of here.' Husband tried to reverse but agents on both sides. Tear gas canister rolled under car, airbags deployed, doors auto-locked trapping family inside. 6-month-old stopped breathing - mother performed CPR. Baby was 'breathing and stable but in serious condition' when police/fire arrived. 3 children with asthma + parents hospitalized. GoFundMe raised $176k+.
outcome_detail: 3 children and parents hospitalized, infant required CPR
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Metro Surge with 2000+ federal agents.

notes: Emiliano's Mexican Restaurant (2 locations). Agents used assault rifles and battering ram. Restaurant accused agents of leaving 'trail of destruction': burned kitchen, torn ceiling tiles, broken doors, safe cut open. Prior June raid aborted when TV crews arrived. Community donated $133k+ for workers.

El Potro Mexican Restaurant. Agents claimed searching for child sex offender. Workers held in booths 3 hours. Federal judge ruled 11 of 12 arrests unlawful (lacked probable cause). DHS ordered to pay attorney fees. Restaurant closed August citing labor challenges.

outcome: Arrested at courthouse steps before hearing
notes: ICE officers captured Tentes-Pitiur by the Elm Street courthouse steps before she could enter for scheduled court appearance. Attorney later built asylum case on persecution in Ecuador and domestic violence in US. On Oct 17, 2025 judge granted asylum based on Ecuador persecution. CT Senate Dems asked Chief Justice to ban ICE courthouse arrests. Chief Justice Raheem Mullins issued policy in Sept 2025 limiting ICE activity at courthouses. Chilling effect reported - DV victims dropped cases, mothers won't request child support.
outcome_detail: Arrested at courthouse steps before hearing; later won asylum
jurisdiction_notes: First city to issue municipal ID cards to undocumented residents (2007). Strong local sanctuary.

outcome: Detained; restraining order extended against ICE
notes: San Jose tattoo artist and immigrant rights organizer. US District Judge Rita Lin extended temporary restraining order against ICE on July 15, 2025. Reyes's case became rallying point - ~100 supporters gathered at SF federal courthouse. ICE claimed he was 'convicted aggravated felon' and arrest constituted 'material change' meriting re-detention. Mission Local documented ~130 ICE arrests at SF/Concord immigration courts since May 2025. Judge Casey Pitts halted ICE courthouse arrests Dec 24, 2025, calling policy 'arbitrary and capricious.'
outcome_detail: Detained; judge extended restraining order against ICE
jurisdiction_notes: Under California Values Act. Santa Clara County is sanctuary.

outcome: Detained outside Seattle Immigration Court after cases dismissed
notes: 3 people detained May 21 and 3-4 more detained May 22 outside Seattle Immigration Court (Henry M. Jackson Federal Building) after their immigration cases were dismissed by judge. NWIRP attorney noticed law enforcement outside. DHS acknowledged arrests at immigration courthouses, stating admin is 'implementing rule of law' and most aliens who entered past 2 years subject to expedited removal. By late June 2025, 817+ people arrested in WA by ICE. WA has state court policy against civil arrests within 1 mile of court without judicial warrant.
outcome_detail: 6-7 detained outside immigration court after hearings dismissed

victim_name: Parishioner at Fuente de Vida Church
outcome: Parishioner arrested outside church after service
notes: ICE agents made arrests in DeKalb County on Sunday June 8, including one person outside Fuente de Vida Church in Tucker who was attending service with family. Additional arrests on Buford Highway in Chamblee and Brookhaven. Came 5 days after Trump revoked 13-year Obama-era policy protecting 'sensitive locations' (churches, schools, hospitals) from ICE enforcement. Considered first reported ICE raid at a church in Trump's second term. At least 10 church-related ICE incidents identified across 5 states since inauguration.
outcome_detail: Parishioner arrested outside church after service

victim_name: Parishioners at 2 San Bernardino Diocese parishes
outcome: Multiple parishioners detained on church grounds
notes: June 20, 2025: ICE detentions at 2 Catholic parishes in San Bernardino Diocese. At St. Adelaide Parish in Highland, agents chased several men into church parking lot where they were detained. At Our Lady of Lourdes in Montclair, longtime parishioner picked up on church property. Coalition of Protestant denominations filed lawsuit July 28 challenging Trump's revocation of sensitive locations policy. Over 10 million Christians in US face deportation threat per Center for Study of Global Christianity. Downey Memorial Church pastor Rev. Tanya Lopez also reported armed masked ICE agents on church parking lot.
outcome_detail: Multiple parishioners detained at 2 Catholic parishes
jurisdiction_notes: San Bernardino County. Under California Values Act.

victim_name: Liam Conejo Ramos (age 5) and Adrian Alexander Conejo Arias (father)

DHS claimed child was 'abandoned' when father fled. Family has active asylum case. Both transferred to Dilley, TX detention center. Four students total detained from Columbia Heights district.

outcome: Patient handcuffed to bed for 28+ hours without warrant
notes: ICE officers entered HCMC Emergency Department without warrant on Dec 31, 2025 to arrest patient seeking medical care. Sat at patient's bedside for ~28 hours while medical staff provided care. Treated patient as in custody, denying family visitation and at times shackling them to bed. State Rep. Aisha Gomez confirmed agents were confronted and removed from HCMC once it was clear they had no cause to be there. Related: Alberto C.M., hospitalized with skull fractures and brain hemorrhages after ICE arrest in St. Paul, remained handcuffed to hospital bed - told staff he was 'dragged and mistreated by federal agents.'
outcome_detail: Patient handcuffed to bed for 28+ hours without warrant
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Metro Surge with 2000+ federal officers.

outcome: ICE contractors camped at hospital for 2 weeks awaiting patient
notes: Taken from Sherman Oaks home July 3, 2025 by ICE agents. During transit, Portillo had health emergency but was left 'handcuffed and covered in vomit' for 8+ hours before being taken to Glendale Memorial Hospital. ICE contractors sat guard in hospital lobby 24 hours a day in shifts for 2 weeks to monitor her movements. Also: Oct 3, 2025, Chicago Ald. Jessie Fuentes handcuffed by federal agents at Humboldt Park Health hospital while asking about patient's ICE warrant - patient (~37 yrs old) had broken leg after being chased by ICE agents.
outcome_detail: ICE contractors camped at hospital for 2 weeks awaiting patient

outcome: Daycare teacher arrested inside facility in front of children
notes: Nov 5, 2025 at Rayito de Sol Spanish Immersion Learning Center: Teacher ran into school after traffic stop, ICE agents grabbed security door as it was closing, entered school and went into multiple rooms looking for teachers while children were present. One teacher hid with child 'afraid that she may die today.' Two agents grabbed woman's arm and dragged her outside, handcuffed against car while she shouted. DHS claimed she was from Colombia without legal status; CBS confirmed she had valid work permit. Mayor Brandon Johnson: arrest 'shocked the conscience of every single Chicagoan.' Nationwide, 1 in 5 childcare workers are immigrants.
outcome_detail: Daycare teacher arrested inside facility in front of children
jurisdiction_notes: Welcoming City Ordinance. Site of numerous 2025 enforcement operations.

outcome: Father of teen cancer patient arrested day after daughter's hospital release
notes: Ruben Torres Maldonado arrested by ICE one day after his 16-year-old daughter Ofelia Torres was released from 39-day hospital stay for chemotherapy and radiation (diagnosed with rare cancer Dec 2024). Officials called arrest 'unconscionable.' Oct 30: Immigration Judge Eva Saltzman set $2,000 bond, stating she saw 'nothing in the record' indicating danger, citing strong family/community ties and no criminal history. Related: 6-year-old leukemia patient from Honduras detained with family on May 29, 2025 after court hearing - missed June 5 cancer appointment while in Dilley facility; released July 2 on parole.
outcome_detail: Father of teen cancer patient arrested, later released on $2k bond
jurisdiction_notes: Welcoming City Ordinance.

outcome: Arrested at USCIS during final green card interview
notes: Utah father and soccer coach Jair Celis arrested by ICE at USCIS Salt Lake City during final green card interview on Dec 2, 2025. No criminal record. Came to US legally as teenager but overstayed visa, lived in US 18 years, married to US citizen Lexi for 5 years. Sent to Las Vegas detention center. Attorney Armstrong: 'Jair's case shows that the rhetoric that we're going after the worst of the worst, that's not true.' ~40 protesters gathered Dec 8 outside USCIS building for 8 hours. Later released. First such arrest in Utah.
outcome_detail: Arrested at USCIS during final green card interview, later released
jurisdiction_notes: Salt Lake City has limited cooperation policies.

outcome: Postpartum mother detained while newborn in NICU
notes: Nayra Guzmán, 22, detained 15 days after difficult C-section birth - her newborn daughter remained in NICU struggling to breathe while mother was at Broadview Processing Center. Still trying to produce breast milk but given limited access to food/water and never provided breast pump. Never assessed by medical professional in custody while managing C-section recovery pain and Type 1 diabetes with supplies from backpack. Biden-era policy restricted ICE from detaining postpartum immigrants except in extreme circumstances; Trump admin has effectively abandoned it. Related: Erika Mateo (24, Guatemala) gave birth under armed guard at Tucson Medical Center in May 2025 after being found in Arizona desert.
outcome_detail: Postpartum mother detained while newborn in NICU
jurisdiction_notes: Welcoming City Ordinance.

victim_name: Andry Jose Hernandez Romero (lead plaintiff) + 237 others
outcome: 238 deported to CECOT mega-prison, 252 later released in prisoner swap
outcome_detail: 238 Venezuelans deported March 15, 2025 (137 under Alien Enemies Act, 101 regular immigration law). Flights departed despite TRO issued by Judge Boasberg. DHS Secretary Noem made decision to continue. Men held incommunicado 4 months, subjected to documented torture: daily beatings, sexual violence, solitary confinement. 48.8% had no US criminal record. Released July 18, 2025 in prisoner swap to Venezuela.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Judge Boasberg issued TRO at 11 AM ordering flights turned around; DOJ admitted Noem proceeded anyway. US paid El Salvador $4.76M for detention with condition: no funds for legal counsel. HRW 'You Have Arrived in Hell' documented: 23-hour solitary, 2x3 meter cells, concrete beds without mattresses, daily beatings. Named individuals: Merwil Gutierrez (TPS, no record), Jhon Chacin (tattoo artist), Franco Caraballo (clock tattoo), Neiyerver Adrian Leon Rengel (detained on 27th birthday despite documents). First use of Alien Enemies Act since WWII. J.G.G. v. Trump filed. Supreme Court ruled April 7 detainees entitled to habeas.

outcome: 177 deported to Venezuela via Honduras on February 20, 2025
outcome_detail: First migrant detention flight to Guantanamo February 4, 2025 following Trump January 29 memo expanding Migrant Operations Center. Nearly 200 Venezuelans transported. 127 held in Camp 6 in individual cells (2x3m, concrete bed, no mattress); 51 in tent facilities not meeting ICE standards. 23-hour solitary, warned not to speak with others. Not informed of destination; families not notified. $40 million monthly cost.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: HRW documented: detainees not informed of destination or legal status, unsanitary conditions, 'climate of extreme fear and intimidation,' beatings, sexual abuse, coercive threats, medical neglect, insufficient food. Legal challenges: Espinoza Escalona v. Noem (March 2025), Gutierrez v. Noem (June 2025). Senator Reed criticized $40M monthly expenditure. 168 organizations demanded closure. UN human rights experts condemned.

outcome: Wrongfully deported to Honduras despite federal court order; Trump administration apologized for 'mistake'
outcome_detail: 19-year-old Babson College freshman detained at Boston Logan November 20 while flying to Texas for Thanksgiving. Surrounded, handcuffed, 'dragged out.' Transferred to military base, flown to Texas, deported November 22 despite emergency court order November 21. ICE officer said order 'did not matter' once out of state. Deported 'in shackles like she's a murder suspect.' Trump administration apologized for 'mistake.' Currently with grandparents in Honduras.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Legal background: Family removal proceedings 2016, appeal dismissed 2017. Had valid work authorization to attend Babson studying business. Father is tailor. Attorney: Todd Pomerleau. January 2: ICE officer declaration admitted he did not notify Port Isabel to abort removal. Pending: T visa for trafficking victims. Fifth known wrongful deportation violating court orders in 2025.
jurisdiction_notes: Trust Act + local policy.

city: Louisiana Detention Facility to Mexico Border
outcome: Trans woman wrongfully deported to Mexico despite judge ruling she would face torture
outcome_detail: Mexican trans woman, US nearly 50 years, lost LPR in 2023 after felony conviction. Immigration Judge Elaine Cintron ruled March 2025 she would face torture/persecution/death in Mexico under CAT. Despite ruling, flown from Louisiana to Texas, taken across border November 11 without money, medications (mental health, HIV prevention), hormones, or phone. Government admitted 'inadvertent.' Fifth wrongful deportation violating orders in 2025.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: 'Sexually trafficked by cartels at age 12' per attorney. Government attempted deportations to Costa Rica, Nicaragua, Honduras, El Salvador since March - all failed. Now living in hiding in Mexico using deadname, family not accepting of trans identity. Mexico one of deadliest countries for trans people. Suing to compel release upon return.

outcome: 2-year-old US citizen deported to Honduras with mother 'with no meaningful process'
outcome_detail: 2-year-old born Baton Rouge 2023, deported with mother Jenny Carolina Lopez-Villela April 25, 2025. Family detained during routine ISAP check-in. ICE officer threatened if mother didn't sign, children would go to foster care. Father given only 1 minute to speak with family while hearing children crying. Notarized custody order for sister-in-law (US citizen) refused. Judge Doughty set hearing 'in the interest of dispelling our strong suspicion that the Government just deported a U.S. citizen with no meaningful process.'
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Same week: two other US citizen children (ages 4 and 7) deported with different mother, including 4-year-old with metastatic cancer. DHS: 'The parents made the decision to take the child with them to Honduras.' Judge Doughty: 'It is illegal and unconstitutional to deport, detain for deportation, or recommend deportation of a U.S. citizen.'

outcome: 10-year-old US citizen recovering from brain cancer surgery deported to Mexico with family
outcome_detail: Texas family with 6 children (5 US citizens) stopped at CBP checkpoint driving from Rio Grande to Houston for daughter's emergency brain cancer checkup. Parents (arrived 2013) given choice: 'separate permanently from our children, or be deported together.' All deported February 4, 2025. 10-year-old had brain surgery to remove tumor in 2024 - doctors 'gave no hope.' Cannot access proper medical care in rural Mexico.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Made 350-mile trip 5+ times before without incident. Brain swelling persists, speech difficulties, right-side mobility impairment. DHS civil rights complaint filed, humanitarian parole applications July 22, 2025. CBP: 'when someone is given expedited removal orders and chooses to disregard them, they will face the consequences.'

outcome: ~60 Russian asylum seekers deported to Moscow via Cairo; all men received military draft summons
outcome_detail: VERIFIED: December 2025 deportation flight with ~60 Russians departed Arizona December 7, stopped in Cairo, arrived Moscow Domodedovo Airport 2:39 AM December 9. Flew in shackles and handcuffs attached to chains across stomachs. In Cairo, ~50 Egyptian security escorted deportees. FSB interrogated deportees for hours. ALL men (including 68-year-old) received military draft summons 'for clarification of data.'
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Known arrests: Zair Syamiullin (70, fraud charges), Artyom Vovchenko (26, military deserter facing 10-year sentence, arrested August 2025). Fourth Russia flight in 2025; total 127 Russians deported 2025 (2022: 58; 2023: 222; 2024: 455). Egypt route established specifically for Russian deportations. Violates non-refoulement principle - deporting asylum seekers to country of claimed persecution.

outcome: Federal judge blocked deportation of 76 unaccompanied Guatemalan children after one plane already took off
outcome_detail: 76 Guatemalan unaccompanied minors roused from beds ~1 AM August 31, 2025, brought onto three planes. One took off but ordered to turn around after Judge Sparkle Sooknanan issued 14-day freeze. Judge received complaint 2 AM, personally tried reaching US Attorney at 3:43 AM. All 10 named plaintiffs declared fear of Guatemala (gang violence, trafficking, family abuse). NILC: 600+ Guatemalan children potentially at risk.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Justice Department claimed 'repatriating' not 'deporting.' 17-year-old in Texas: 'I felt like I lost my breath for a second because they had never woken us up in the middle of the night before.' First known attempt at mass deportation of unaccompanied minors under second Trump administration.

outcome: Mother and both children deported to Honduras
outcome_detail: VERIFIED: Julia (30) and two daughters (Jade, 2, US citizen; Janelle, 11, Honduran) deported April 25, 2025 to Honduras. Julia was ~6 weeks pregnant at deportation. Signed consent ONLY after agents threatened foster care for Jade. Attorneys: 'pure exercise of force.'
notes: VERIFIED per LA Illuminator/NBC: Julia arrived at US border 2019 fleeing Honduras after Janelle was kidnapped there. Forced to wait in Mexico under 'Remain in Mexico' policy; family was kidnapped in Mexico before returning to US Aug 2021. Partner Jacob (children's father) left in Louisiana. ACLU/NIPNLG lawsuit (J.L.V. v. Acuna) names AG Bondi, DHS Sec Noem, ICE Dir Lyons. DHS spokesperson McLaughlin: 'false and irresponsible' that US citizen children being deported.
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ designated but Louisiana is anti-sanctuary state. City has historically limited cooperation but constrained by state law.

outcome: 361 arrested, 14 children 'rescued', 12+ US citizen children left parentless, 1 worker killed
outcome_detail: Massive raid on Glass House Farms cannabis sites in Santa Barbara/Ventura counties. DHS claimed 14 migrant children 'rescued' from exploitation. However, 12+ US citizen children left without parents. Jaime Alanis Garcia died falling 30 feet while evading ICE. One pregnant mother had chemical spilled on leg, hospitalized. 16-year-old Alexa left caring for 6-year-old and 10-month-old sisters alone.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Congressman Carbajal denied access, condemned 'troubling lack of transparency.' Rubber bullets and flash bangs used against crowds. United Farm Workers: some workers including US citizens 'remain totally unaccounted for.' DHS claimed convicted child predator found working near minors. House Republicans launched investigation.

victim_name: Jaime Ramirez, Noemi Chavez, Dasha (8), son (3)
outcome: Family detained at Millennium Park, separated; mother and children released after court order, father in Texas
outcome_detail: Family from Albany Park detained by Border Patrol at Millennium Park - 8-year-old Dasha had requested outing. Video shows Dasha clinging to doll, crying as armed agents detained family. Father transferred to Texas, mother/children held at O'Hare. Federal judge ordered family protected. Mother/children released October 2, father remains in Texas. Family has asylum appointment October 2027.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Part of Operation Midway Blitz. Gov. Pritzker: 'invasion'; Mayor Johnson: 'what it meant for us as a city.' 8-year-old ran toward father surrounded by armed agents. Second group encircled mother helping 3-year-old with shoes. National Immigrant Justice Center representing. Judge later ruled ICE violated 2022 consent decree with warrantless arrests.
jurisdiction_notes: Welcoming City Ordinance. Site of numerous 2025 enforcement operations.

sources.name: Block Club Chicago / Chicago Tribune / CNN

outcome: 37 arrested, 4 US citizen children detained, 1 US citizen adult detained 3 hours
outcome_detail: Around 1 AM, armed federal agents rappelled from helicopters onto 5-story apartment in South Shore. Agents kicked down doors, threw flashbangs. 37 arrested from Venezuela, Mexico, Colombia, Nigeria. 4 US citizen children detained 'until placed in care of guardians.' Governor Pritzker reported children zip-tied (DHS denies). US citizen Rodrick Johnson (67) detained in zip ties for 3 hours before release.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Part of Operation Midway Blitz. Gov. Pritzker: 'Imagine being a child awakened in the middle of the night by a Black Hawk helicopter landing... armed stranger forcibly removing you from bed, zip-tying your hands, separating you from your family.' Eyewitness saw children 'zip tied to each other.' DHS: 'shameful and disgusting lie.' Rodrick Johnson (US citizen) door broken down, dragged out, told to wait until they 'looked him up.' October 7: House Committees launched investigation.
jurisdiction_notes: Welcoming City Ordinance. Site of numerous 2025 enforcement operations.

victim_name: Elvis Joel Tipan Echeverria, Chloe Renata Tipan Villacis
outcome: Father and 2-year-old detained, flown to Texas despite court order, toddler returned next day
outcome_detail: ICE agents followed Elvis and 2-year-old Chloe from grocery store to home. Both detained. Family has pending asylum - in country legally, no final removal order. Federal Judge Menendez issued emergency order at 8:11 PM to release child by 9:30 PM citing 'irreparable harm.' Despite order, at 8:30 PM ICE put both on commercial flight to Texas. Toddler returned Friday after court intervention. Father remains in custody. 1,000+ community members donated nearly $50,000 within hours.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Child has lived in Minneapolis 'since her arrival in the United States as a newborn.' Attorney: 'recovering from this horrific ordeal.' ICE defied federal judge's order - informed court AFTER pair was on flight (19 minutes after order). 9th child detained in Minnesota that month (ages 2-17). Part of broader Minnesota enforcement causing Minneapolis Public Schools to move to remote learning.
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.

outcome: Parent detained at school bus stop in front of child and busload of students
outcome_detail: Parent detained by ICE while waiting with child at school bus stop. Children on bus and at stop witnessed arrest. All students including child of arrested parent were able to board bus. Child left with 'traumatizing image of their parent being detained while they are bussed to school.'
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Superintendent Teri Staloch confirmed. Rep. Cedrick Frazier: 'Waiting for the school bus is a fundamental, mundane part of American parenthood... targeting parents as they perform the basic duty of getting their children to school is abhorrent and un-American. No child should have to sit in a classroom wondering if their parent will be there when they get home.' Part of broader Minnesota surge causing Minneapolis Public Schools to cancel in-person classes.

sources.name: Bring Me The News / KARE11 / KSTP

notes: Hyundai Motor Group Metaplant America (EV battery plant construction site). LARGEST single-site worksite enforcement action in DHS history. Workers allegedly violated visa terms.

ONE WORKER KILLED (Jaime Alanis Garcia fell 30 ft from roof). 12 workers injured, 8 hospitalized. 14 undocumented minors found (8 unaccompanied). Armored vehicles and National Guard deployed. MASSIVE identity theft scheme uncovered - ~70 workers using stolen identities affecting 100+ US citizen victims who lost federal aid, disability benefits. Plant dropped to 20% production. City-wide chilling effect.

sources.name: CNN / Flatwater Free Press / NBC News

notes: Operation Midway Blitz (ongoing). ~1,900 detained in first half. Most arrested had no criminal record. Intended to crack down on sanctuary policies. Federal judge ruled 22 arrests violated consent decree banning warrantless arrests. Restaurants closed, sales dropped 20-30%. One US citizen detained (Debbie Brockman, WGN-TV employee).

Operation Metro Surge. Called LARGEST immigration enforcement operation ever by DHS. ~3,000 ICE and Border Patrol agents deployed. 3,300+ detained by mid-January 2026. Only 5% (103 of 2,000) had violent crime records. TWO US CITIZENS KILLED (Renee Good Jan 7, Alex Pretti Jan 24). Multiple lawsuits alleging racial profiling, constitutional violations. Cost Minneapolis $2M+ in overtime in 4 days.
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.

outcome: NYC Council employee detained at immigration appointment
outcome_detail: Rafael Andres Rubio Bohorquez, 53-year-old Venezuelan national working as NYC Council data analyst, detained during 'routine' immigration appointment on Long Island. Council Speaker Julie Menin claimed he was cleared to remain until October 2026. DHS said he has 'no authorization' and prior assault arrest. Mayor Mamdani called it 'egregious government overreach.'
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: First major ICE confrontation for Mayor Zohran Mamdani, NYC's first socialist mayor (sworn in January 1, 2026). Mamdani: 'I am in support of abolishing ICE... an entity that has no interest in fulfilling its stated reason to exist.' DHS Assistant Secretary McLaughlin: 'shocking' that 'criminal illegal alien with no authorization' employed by City Council. Governor Hochul: 'This is exactly what happens when immigration enforcement is weaponized.'
jurisdiction_notes: Executive Order 41 (2003, expanded). Strongest municipal protections.

outcome: Lawsuit filed then dismissed after judge found policies similar
outcome_detail: Denver Public Schools (first school district to sue) filed lawsuit against Trump's rescission of sensitive locations policy. Student attendance dropped 3% in February 2025 (up to 4.7% at schools with many immigrant students). U.S. District Judge Daniel Domenico rejected attempt to reinstate policy, finding 'little practical difference.' DPS dismissed lawsuit without prejudice.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: DPS serves 90,000 students, 52% Latino. ~4,000 new immigrant students (mostly Venezuelan) by end of 2022. Lawsuit argued rescission violated APA, constitutional rights to religious freedom and due process, would deter access to essential services. January 20, 2025, Trump rescinded Biden-era sensitive locations policy (in place since 2011). New policy emphasized 'common sense' discretion with no hard limits. 1,400+ churches obtained federal injunction protection in Maryland. California passed laws limiting arrests at schools/universities/hospitals.
jurisdiction_notes: Denver Public Schools filed (later dismissed) lawsuit over sensitive locations.

notes: Military-style raid at 1:00 AM with 300 federal agents. 4 US CITIZEN CHILDREN taken into custody. Witnesses reported children zip-tied, dragged out without clothes. Governor Pritzker condemned the tactics. Part of Operation Midway Blitz.
jurisdiction_notes: Welcoming City Ordinance. Site of numerous 2025 enforcement operations.

notes: Operation Tidal Wave. Florida leads nation with 295 287(g) agreements. 1,120+ detained. Epicenter of construction industry raids. Part of DHS nationwide enforcement surge.

Operation Catch of the Day. Named for Maine fishing industry. 100+ detained with ~1,400 targets identified. Downtown Lewiston described as "empty" due to fear. Only 4 with criminal records publicly acknowledged. Thousands rallied in protest.
jurisdiction_notes: Police prohibited from immigration enforcement since 1987.

court: U.S. District Court District of Columbia
outcome_detail: Judge Howell blocked widespread arrests without warrants or flight risk determinations. Required detailed documentation for any warrantless civil immigration arrest. Government must demonstrate probable cause and flight risk before arrest.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Fourth Amendment requires warrants or probable cause for arrests. ICE conducting widespread arrests without either. CASA (immigrant advocacy organization) challenged as unconstitutional. Court imposed documentation requirements. ACLU of DC represented plaintiffs.
jurisdiction_notes: DC Sanctuary Values Act (2019). Does not honor ICE detainers.

court: U.S. District Court District of Colorado
outcome: 66-page ruling found ICE 'policy, pattern, practice' of unconstitutional arrests
outcome_detail: Judge Jackson ruled in 66-page opinion that ICE had 'policy, pattern, and/or practice' of warrantless arrests without probable cause. Class action preliminarily certified covering 169,000 people. Found systematic Fourth Amendment violations.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Comprehensive ruling documenting systematic constitutional violations. ACLU of Colorado brought suit after Operation Aurora and subsequent enforcement. Court found not isolated incidents but intentional policy. Largest class certification in immigration enforcement case. Appeals expected.
jurisdiction_notes: Denver Public Schools filed (later dismissed) lawsuit over sensitive locations.

court: U.S. District Court Southern District of New York
outcome: Detention conditions injunction - capacity limits, meals, hygiene required
outcome_detail: Judge Kaplan extended capacity restrictions (50 sq ft/person), required three meals daily, sleeping mats, hygiene supplies, and confidential attorney calls within 24 hours at 26 Federal Plaza holding facility.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: 26 Federal Plaza used as processing center for NYC arrests. Overcrowded conditions, lack of food and hygiene. Due process requires humane conditions during detention. Court imposed specific requirements. NYC legal aid organizations represented plaintiffs.
jurisdiction_notes: Executive Order 41 (2003, expanded). Strongest municipal protections.

court: U.S. District Court District of Columbia
outcome: Unaccompanied minors protected from automatic adult detention transfer
outcome_detail: Court blocked Trump administration policy to automatically transfer minors turning 18 into adult detention. Enforced 2021 permanent injunction. Required individual assessments before any transfer.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Unaccompanied minors have special protections under Flores settlement and TVPRA. Trump policy attempted automatic transfers on 18th birthday without assessment. Court found violation of existing injunction. Affects thousands of minors aging out of UAC system.
jurisdiction_notes: DC Sanctuary Values Act (2019). Does not honor ICE detainers.

court: U.S. District Court District of Massachusetts
outcome: Bond hearing denials ruled unlawful through systematic misclassification
outcome_detail: Court declared it unlawful to deny bond hearings to thousands in New England through systematic misclassification under wrong statutory authority. ICE using inapplicable mandatory detention statutes to deny hearings.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: ICE systematically classifying detainees under mandatory detention statutes that don't apply to them. Denies due process right to bond hearing. Pattern documented across New England facilities. Court ordered individualized review of classifications.
jurisdiction_notes: Trust Act + local policy.

court: U.S. District Court District of Minnesota
outcome: First Amendment protections for protesters, chemical agents banned
outcome_detail: Judge Menendez issued preliminary injunction barring ICE retaliation against peaceful protesters. Prohibited arrests and use of chemical agents against demonstrators. Found First Amendment protections apply to immigration protest.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: After Renee Good and Alex Pretti killings, protests erupted across Minneapolis. Federal agents used tear gas and pepper spray on crowds. Court found First Amendment protects right to protest immigration enforcement. ACLU of Minnesota represented plaintiffs.
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.

court: U.S. District Court District of Minnesota
outcome: Racial profiling class action certified during Operation Metro Surge
outcome_detail: Challenges warrantless arrests and racial profiling during Operation Metro Surge. Named plaintiff Mubashir Khalif Hussen, 20-year-old US citizen detained despite repeatedly stating citizenship. Class action certified for racial profiling claims.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Operation Metro Surge targeted Cedar-Riverside and other immigrant neighborhoods. US citizens detained based on appearance. Mubashir Hussen held in chokehold despite stating citizenship. Class action alleges Fourth and Fourteenth Amendment violations. Related to T3-008 and T4-073.
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.

court: U.S. District Court District of Massachusetts
outcome: Class action challenging $998/day civil fines totaling $6 billion
outcome_detail: Class action challenging $998/day civil fines totaling $6 billion issued to 21,500+ immigrants. Alleges Eighth Amendment excessive fines violation. Fines issued for failure to depart despite no practical ability to leave.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: DHS imposing $998/day fines on immigrants who don't self-deport. Total fines exceed $6 billion. Many recipients have no ability to leave due to lack of travel documents or home country refusing return. Public Justice and ACLU challenge as unconstitutional excessive fines.
jurisdiction_notes: Trust Act + local policy.

victim_name: Franklin Norberto Bautista Reyes, Joan Sebastian Castaneda Lozada, Andres Felipe Pineda Mogollon, Joel Enrrique Sandoval-Lopez
outcome_detail: Uprising triggered by detainees not receiving food for over 20 hours. Four escaped by breaking through drywall, dropping mattresses to land, using bed sheets to cover barbed wire. All detainees evacuated within 24 hours and transferred to red state facilities. Escapees captured over following weeks with $10,000 reward.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Delaney Hall first ICE center to open under second Trump administration (February 2025) via $1 billion 15-year GEO Group contract. Uprising caused by: 20+ hours without food, scalding undrinkable tap water, insufficient staff. Newark Mayor Baraka demanded answers. DHS denied revolt. Following escape, ICE transferred detainees to red states for more favorable judges.

outcome_detail: Cuban detainees at Krome spelled 'S.O.S' and 'CUBA' with their bodies and towels on facility grounds in south Miami-Dade. Protested being held without release information and feared transfer outside US.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Detainees reported: worms in food, toilets flooding floors with fecal waste, days without showers or prescription medicine, mosquitoes everywhere, lights on all night, AC shutting off in tropical heat. Amnesty International later released report describing conditions as fitting international definitions of torture. Cubans planning hunger strike to protest transfers.

outcome: Some strikers hospitalized, DHS denied hunger strike occurred
outcome_detail: At least dozen detainees refused food for nearly two weeks protesting inhumane conditions at newly opened state facility. Pedro Hernandez hospitalized but continued refusing food. DHS called reports 'hoax spread by criminal illegal aliens.'
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Alligator Alcatraz opened July 2025 at former training airport in Everglades under Governor DeSantis. Capacity 3,000 expandable to 4,000. Amnesty International 61-page report 'Torture and Enforced Disappearances in the Sunshine State' described 2x2 punishment cages where detainees shackled in Florida sun for hours without food/water. DeSantis press secretary called report 'politically motivated attack.'

outcome: State denied hunger strike, claimed only 3 refused meals
outcome_detail: 19 detainees launched hunger strike protesting deplorable conditions and lack of medical care at former solitary confinement facility. Many previously held at Alligator Alcatraz before abrupt transfer. State contradicted reports, said detainees didn't refuse meals until after news coverage.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Camp J at Angola previously known as 'the Dungeon' for solitary confinement. Closed 2018 due to malfunctioning locks, reopened September 2025 for ICE. Governor Landry announced 208 'criminal illegal aliens' expanding to 400. Demands: medical/mental health care, prescription medications, toilet paper, hygiene products, clean water, ICE officer visits. ACLU filed lawsuit October 2025 alleging inhumane conditions.

facility: Louisiana ICE Processing Center, Camp J (Angola State Penitentiary)
outcome: Guards in riot gear placed strikers in solitary confinement
outcome_detail: September 17-26, 2025: 19 detainees began hunger strike at Camp J (Angola); 4 continued after 10 days. Protesting: lack of medical/mental health care, missing medications (one needs hernia surgery delayed 2 months), insufficient hygiene products, toilet paper, clean water. 'Mr. X' hospitalized then placed in solitary without running water, walker confiscated, medications withheld.
notes: VERIFIED per NIPNLG Sept 26, 2025: Guards in riot gear retaliated by placing hunger strikers in disciplinary solitary confinement, restricting outside contact. Detainee quote: 'We are treated like dirt, like trash.' ICE and Louisiana DOC involved. Officials denied allegations (NOLA.com Sept 22). Louisiana holds 7,000+ ICE detainees (second to Texas); 98% in for-profit facilities.

outcome: Both escapees recaptured, ICE delayed notification 4+ hours
outcome_detail: Two detainees escaped during power outage when doors opened. Joel Gonzalez-Gonzalez captured by Adams County Sheriff ~12 miles from facility. ICE waited 4+ hours to notify local police, drawing criticism.

outcome: Stun grenades and physical force used against detainees
outcome_detail: Violent incident where FDC staff used stun grenades and physical force against detainees protesting denial of food, water, and medical attention.

FDC (Bureau of Prisons facility) started holding ICE detainees late Feb 2025. Detainees reported extreme overcrowding, unsanitary conditions, broken toilets, degrading treatment. In one incident, detainees forced to eat while shackled with hands behind backs - 'We had to bend over and eat off the chairs with our mouths, like dogs.' 2025 was deadliest year for ICE detainees since 2004 with 31 deaths.

outcome: Rally held outside ICE LA field office to amplify demands
outcome_detail: Over 50 detainees at Adelanto launched combined hunger and labor strike. Part of Detention Watch Network's 'Communities Not Cages' National Day of Action with 17 demonstrations nationwide.

ACLU documented retaliation including solitary confinement. 'Communities Not Cages' campaign co-hosted by AFSC and Immigrant Justice Network.

victim_name: Maria Alejandra Montoya Sanchez and others
outcome: 80% of facility protested, ICE/CBP police rushed to scene
outcome_detail: ~1,500 people (80% of facility) protested after guards abruptly ordered attorneys to leave. Detainees including many children poured into open areas chanting 'Libertad.' Triggered by news of 5-year-old Liam Ramos and Minneapolis events. Dozens of ICE/CBP police cars raced to area.

Maria Montoya Sanchez, 31, held with 9-year-old daughter since October: 'We're immigrants, with children, not criminals.' National Center for Youth Law: conditions 'fundamentally unsafe for anyone, let alone young children.'

outcome: Ongoing protest over prolonged detention and abuse
outcome_detail: Five men including Eugenio Castaneda Ferrer refused entry to cells during count. Three commenced hunger strike demanding freedom. May 2025 advocates reported sewage again flooding cells.

Sued for 2020 chemical attack on peaceful COVID-19 hunger strikers. Kesley Vial died by suicide August 2022 after meeting officials. Strikers faced: solitary, force-feeding threats, fabricated misconduct reports, expedited deportations.

outcome_detail: Avelo ICE flight declared emergency when cabin lost pressure; plane made rapid descent; 6 of 88 passengers injured with nosebleeds
notes: November 13, 2025: Avelo ICE deportation flight experienced cabin pressure loss mid-flight. The plane made a rapid descent and landed safely. Abughazaleh later indicted with 5 others for felony assault/conspiracy charges; she proclaimed innocence, called it 'political prosecution.'
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

notes: VERIFIED per Tribune/Sun-Times: Sept 19, 2025 at Broadview ICE facility. Chicago Alderman Rossana Rodriguez-Sanchez struck by pepper ball projectiles. Multiple elected officials injured at this event including Lt. Gov. Stratton.
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

notes: VERIFIED per Tribune/Sun-Times: Sept 19, 2025 at Broadview ICE facility. Chicago Alderman Maria Hadden struck by pepper balls. Multiple elected officials targeted during Operation Midway Blitz protests.
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

notes: VERIFIED per Block Club/Tribune: Sept 19, 2025 Broadview ICE facility. Clergy member struck by pepper balls during prayer vigil. Multiple clergy and religious leaders targeted during peaceful vigil.
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

victim_name: Dean Moses, L. Vural Elibol, Olga Fedorova
notes: Three journalists assaulted by ICE agents at immigration court. Dean Moses (amNewYork) grabbed by masked agents. L. Vural Elibol (Anadolu Agency, Turkey) thrown to ground, hospitalized with neck injury. Olga Fedorova (AP freelancer) shoved to floor.
jurisdiction_notes: Part of NYC. Under NYC Executive Order 41.

notes: Emmy Award-winning journalist (founder of MG News) arrested while livestreaming law enforcement activities. Was wearing PRESS vest. ICE claimed he was a danger to the community because he livestreamed law enforcement. Detained over 100 days, then DEPORTED to El Salvador on October 3, 2025.

Family of 8 (2 adults, 6 children) tear gassed when canister went under their vehicle. 6-MONTH-OLD INFANT STOPPED BREATHING and required CPR. 2 children with severe asthma hospitalized. Part of Operation Metro Surge.
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.

notes: CBS Chicago reporter had pepper ball fired at her vehicle. NO PROTESTERS present at the time. Suffered vomiting, burning sensation on face, chemical irritation. Criminal investigation launched by Broadview Police.
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

notes: After 24+ hours of peaceful protest over detention of asylum-seeking family, federal agents used pepper spray and rubber bullets against protesters forming human chain. Brian Rogers shot in neck and back with rubber bullets. Drew Collie (22) shot twice at close range. Franci Stagi (57) thrown to ground by federal agent. CBI investigation launched.
outcome_detail: 3+ injured by rubber bullets and physical force
jurisdiction_notes: Site of ICE field office protest with rubber bullets, pepper spray Oct 2025.

notes: Protests over poor conditions at Delaney Hall detention center. Officers sprayed pepper spray, tackled and dragged protesters. Multiple minor injuries. 4 detainees escaped during disturbance.
jurisdiction_notes: Mayor Ras Baraka publicly defied ICE Jan 2025.

notes: 77 people arrested during sit-in at 26 Federal Plaza protesting conditions at NYC immigration holding facility. Arrested officials included NYC Public Advocate Jumaane Williams, State Sen. Julia Salazar, and City Council Member Tiffany Caban. Officials sat encircled around sign with slash through 'ICE'. Agents bound hands with plastic ties and paraded them down hallway. Federal judge had extended order requiring improved treatment of detainees.
jurisdiction_notes: Executive Order 41 (2003, expanded). Strongest municipal protections.

notes: Thousands flooded Foley Square in Lower Manhattan protesting Trump administration immigration crackdown. Of 86 people detained, 52 received summonses and 34 were arrested on charges including disorderly conduct and obstructing governmental administration. Protests turned violent after bottles thrown at NYPD officers.
jurisdiction_notes: Executive Order 41 (2003, expanded). Strongest municipal protections.

outcome: 78 arrested in Central Valley agricultural sweep
notes: Border Patrol agents in unmarked vehicles arrested 78 undocumented immigrants in Fresno and Kern counties. Some Kern County farms saw 85% workforce absence after news spread. More than half of pruning crews did not show up. Immigration sweeps caught elected officials and advocates off guard. Catholic mass attendance fell in Fresno Diocese.
jurisdiction_notes: Central Valley - agricultural region with large undocumented workforce.

notes: Jose Manuel Sanchez-Castro died 5 days after being booked into Northwest ICE Processing Center operated by GEO Group. Arrested at home in Eastern Washington. Family filed lawsuit. FOIA request filed seeking all records on detention, medical treatment, and death. Tacoma facility has one of worst track records for deaths in custody per ACLU.
jurisdiction_notes: Northwest ICE Processing Center - privately operated by GEO Group.

notes: Charles Leo Daniel died at Northwest ICE Processing Center. Activists report he died while in solitary confinement and hung himself with a blanket. Had been in solitary confinement for 1,418 days according to Rep. Jayapal's office confirmation with ICE. Facility conditions described as 'nightmare' with pattern of medical neglect.
outcome_detail: death in solitary confinement after 1,418 days
jurisdiction_notes: Northwest ICE Processing Center - privately operated by GEO Group.

outcome: 57 detained at snack bar factory, judge ruled unconstitutional seizure
notes: Dozens of masked federal agents raided Nutrition Bar Confectioners in Cato, NY. Claimed 'violent felon' inside but detained anyone who 'looked Latinx'. 69 initially detained, 57 still in custody or deported. Workers mostly from Central America/Guatemala, many lived in region for decades. Reports of knees on necks, blows to heads during raid. Federal judge ruled agents violated Fourth Amendment - 'unreasonable seizure' instead of consensual questioning allowed under warrant. 21 cases involve parent separation from children including 3 babies (7-15 months old).
outcome_detail: 57 detained, federal judge ruled unconstitutional seizure
jurisdiction_notes: Cayuga County, upstate NY. Governor Hochul visited facility after raid.

outcome: Pastor detained while driving to work
notes: Daniel Fuentes Espinal, pastor of Iglesia del Nazareno in Easton since 2015, detained by ICE while driving to hardware store for construction work. Unpaid pastor who fled violence in Honduras in 2001. No criminal record. Had been working toward US citizenship. Detained at Baltimore facility. Called 'pillar of Eastern Shore community' by locals.
outcome_detail: Pastor detained while driving to work
jurisdiction_notes: Talbot County, Eastern Shore of Maryland.

outcome: ICE arrests parishioner on church property
notes: ICE agents picked up longtime parishioner of Our Lady of Lourdes Church in Montclair on church property. Same day, agents chased several men onto parking lot of St. Adelaide parish in Highland. Shows ramped up enforcement disturbing places once deemed protected after Trump revoked Obama-era sensitive locations policy on Jan 20, 2025.
jurisdiction_notes: San Bernardino County, California.

outcome: ~100 clergy members arrested at MSP airport protest
notes: Approximately 100 clergy members arrested while protesting at Minneapolis-St. Paul International Airport, calling for end to ICE arrests in the area. Protest came amid tensions following fatal shootings of Renee Good and Alex Pretti by federal agents. Faith leaders from multiple denominations participated.
jurisdiction_notes: Site of Operation Tidal Wave. Tensions high after 2 federal agent killings of US citizens.

outcome: 3 arrested for disrupting church service of ICE field director who serves as pastor
notes: Three protesters arrested for disrupting church service at Cities Church in St. Paul, where ICE field director David Easterwood serves as pastor. Charged under FACE Act (Freedom of Access to Clinic Entrances Act) - law originally written to protect abortion clinics. AG Pam Bondi personally announced arrests. Don Lemon was present but not charged.
outcome_detail: 3 arrested under FACE Act at church protest
jurisdiction_notes: Cities Church belongs to Southern Baptist Convention. Pastor is also local ICE field director.

outcome: 7 arrested at car wash in labor exploitation investigation
notes: ICE conducted worksite enforcement at Complete Autowash in Philadelphia. Seven undocumented immigrants arrested - six from Mexico, one from Dominican Republic. All had worked at car wash for at least 15 years. Anonymous worker alleged $100/day cash pay, no benefits, threats of deportation for complaints. Owner said ICE never showed warrant. Detainees held at Moshannon Valley Processing Center.
jurisdiction_notes: Philadelphia - sanctuary city. Fourth Amendment concerns raised by community.

outcome: State Rep. Adelita Grijalva pepper sprayed during ICE raid protest
notes: Federal ICE agents pepper-sprayed newly sworn-in Arizona State Rep. Adelita Grijalva during confrontation at Taco Giro restaurant raid. Video shows agent indiscriminately dousing line of people with pepper spray. Agents also deployed tear gas canisters and fired pepper balls at protesters, journalists and observers while dispersing crowd outside restaurant parking lot.
outcome_detail: State rep and multiple protesters pepper sprayed
jurisdiction_notes: Arizona - aggressive cooperation with federal enforcement.

outcome: ICE pepper spray hits toddler in car
notes: Rafael Veraza was pulling out of Sam's Club parking lot with window down when ICE pepper spray hit him on side of head. His toddler daughter in back seat was also affected by chemicals. Video shows Veraza struggling to drive and wiping eyes while child is in distress. Part of pattern of force concerns during ICE operations.
outcome_detail: Man and toddler exposed to pepper spray
jurisdiction_notes: Cicero, IL - not sanctuary. Part of Chicago metro area.

outcome: ICE pepper sprays protesters and reporter at immigration court
notes: Federal ICE agents pepper-sprayed protesters and reporter in San Francisco after arresting asylum-seeker in immigration court. Chaotic street scene caught on video - agents pulled out batons and tasers, tackled several protesters to ground, detaining at least one. Part of pattern of escalating force during immigration enforcement.
outcome_detail: Protesters and reporter pepper sprayed, one detained
jurisdiction_notes: San Francisco - strongest sanctuary city protections.

outcome: Landscaper tased and pepper sprayed during ICE arrest
notes: Landscaper allegedly tased and pepper-sprayed by ICE agents during arrest in Beverly Hills. Cell phone video captured confrontation with agents shouting commands in Spanish. Bystanders questioned use of taser. CBS News review of hundreds of videos found repeated instances of excessive force. Former federal agent Eric Balliet: 'They are elevating the force to a degree that is excessive.'
jurisdiction_notes: Beverly Hills, Los Angeles County.

notes: Video taken at Skyline Gardens housing development shows aftermath of alleged pepper spray incident. 15-year-old girl seated on pavement coughing while observer yells 'Why would you pepper spray a 15-year-old kid?' Part of ICE raids in Owatonna. Multiple videos emerged of raids in area.
jurisdiction_notes: Owatonna, Minnesota. Part of state-wide ICE operations.

outcome: 5 arrested at government contractor including general manager
notes: ICE agents raided San Diego Powder & Protective Coatings, a government contractor. Four employees arrested along with company's general manager. Employees accused of falsifying work documents; business accused of knowingly hiring employees without work authorizations. One of few raids where employer faced charges alongside workers.
jurisdiction_notes: San Diego - sanctuary city. Rare case where employer charged.

outcome: 31 detained across construction sites and local business
notes: ICE conducted series of 'targeted' worksite enforcement operations to inspect employers' I-9 records across two construction sites and a local business in Laredo. ICE worked with federal, state, and local law enforcement to detain 31 people for immigration violations.
jurisdiction_notes: Laredo, Texas - border city with active ICE presence.
